reviews.review_msg: Very interesting course material, but DO NOT disagree with this professor. Prof Fergusson is very woke, so if you can repeat back to her what she wants to hear - by all means take her source. If you question or disagree with her - look out.
Hard Class

First and foremost these comments don't do her justice. Yes, she is a tough marker but it is only in your best interest to actually improve your writing, where Karen is most effective is her strength in knowledge of the subject at hand. She handles it with the care and respect it demands, leading to great tutorial dialogues. I would take again.

Such a hard marker. I typically get A's on my papers and I'm confident in the way I write. She has a very strict writing style and seems to be very bias. She is a wonderful person, but her grading is very difficult. I took this class as an elective and regret it.
Tough grader. Considers her opinion as the best.

Professor Ferguson is a very nice person and a decent teacher as well. However, she is a tough grader. You really need to think the question through and arrive at a specific thesis. And I wouldn't have a problem with that, it's just her way of structuring and forming questions were extremely vague which made it a bit irritating.

Karen is DEFINITELY a tough marker with high expectations. However, she is also extremely passionate and her seminars are very informative. Readings and discussions were always well connected. Participation matters and attendance is necessary. Be prepared for a challenge. I would've loved the chance to take another class with her.

Really enjoyed both the content and the lectures and while a tough marker, isn't that what we want in a prof? To become better researchers and writers? You will think she's too obsessed with race only if you race ist leanings. She made herself very available for help and open to conflicting POV's. This is a class for anyone interested in justice
Very diffcult essay marker, got a B average. Nice tutotrial discusison, but she is too obsessed with race

For a 200 level class, she grades as though its a 400 level course. Impossible to make a good grade, especially if your a guy. EVERYTHING is related to Race as far as course material.  Every question is one sided and she hates every ones opinion.  IF you have any opinion or think outside what she calls "history" then stay away from this class.

I can accept the fact that she's hard. It's the fact that she's totally incoherent, condescending, un-engaging... need I go on? I can echo the sentiment that you better be a blithering sycophant to answer any of her typecast essay questions. Worst prof I've had at SFU, tied for worst ever. Could have been a great course.

As Karen had stated in her lecture, she teaches you "the Ferguson" version of U.S History. She assigns questions in a way where you have to agree with her opinion in order to answer the question. Her focus throughout the course is on black civil rights (ie. sharecroppers, civil rights act, etc.)

AVOID THIS PROF!!!  "Discussions" are vague questions posed with specific answers in mind. Awkward silences are part of every lecture.  Claims to "run a tight ship" but comes across as condescending and narcissistic.

By far the worst History Prof at SFU.  She has no tact whatsoever and constantly belittles her students in class.  There is only one opinion that matters in Karen Ferguson's class: her own (which is a shame since the course content is fascinating).

By far the worst professor I have ever taking. This class took 3 times as much time as anyother class and she still was not satisfied. Her discussions are pretty much her leading you by the hand to say what she wants. DO NOT TAKE HER. I have never used this site before, but because of her I will always check here before picking my classes.

Previous reviewer is spot on: discussion essentially amounts to guess what Karen thinks is right! Quite an exercise in frustration, but if jumping through academic hoops with no thoughts of your own happens to be your thing, you might just like her
Hard marker for the papers and she is very picky at the grammer. Ok lecturer.

Do not take this prof if you have any thoughts of your own. Poses questions in such a way that only one conclusion can be reached-the one she waits for 10 minutes to hear. If it's not the response she is thinking of, the answer is wrong. In papers, she looks at grammar more than content. Hard marker, no textbooks and no laptops in class. Rubbish!!

The woman is brilliant, like talking to a library, I'd like to check her brain out. She should be running the gov't somewhere. Not a great lecturer, scatters her thoughts. True, she's one tough marker, forget about a B if you're a slaker. She's hot if you like the type, reminds me of Marcie from Married w/ Children.
Really hard prof, no doubt about it. Avoid her if you just wanna take an elective for interest. Anybody know if she scales the term? thanks

An amazing prof on the teaching side, very passionate about her work.DO NOT TAKE HER UNLESS YOU ARE A MACHINE! Grades papers with a blowtorch.I'm an A+ student and got solid B's outside the exams.Likes parrots.Think she teaches because she lost her job at the death camp.
very rewarding content- I really enjoyed her classes
DO NOT take this prof unless you're ready to dedicate 3x as much time as you do studying for other classes. She's helpful but a total hard-ass. Frighteningly smart. High expectations.
Unbelievably difficult

I don't know what everyone is complaining about. Yes, she is a hard marker but she's extremely up front and clear about what she expects and more than willing to help if you go to her her office hours. She has zero patience for lazy students who don't come prepared and rightfully so! A great prof if you want to learn and improve your writing.

Karen is a very passionate about what she teaches. She is very specific about what she expects from her students but she is also available and helpful when you come prepared to see her. It is a pleasure taking any course with Karen and those who don't miss out on a fantastic learning experience!
Yes she is hard. Lots of reading and she expects perfection on your papers. But you do learn a lot. She really knows her stuff. Don't take this course unless you are prepared to really work.

Yes, she is a hard marker, and expects a lot of you. I don't think I've ever been stressed out more from a course before. I have to say this though, she pushes you to preform your best; this course while the hardest, ended up being the most rewarding class I've taken at SFU. Through a lot of sweat I also produced the best history paper I've ever wr

I have to agree with all the other ratings: she is a HARD marker. Expects alot. An intense amount of reading. Lots of assignments that take up entire days to finish. She's very helpful if you go to talk to her but that's only worthwhile if you agree with EVERYTHING she lectures about and are willing to accept her version of history. Don't take her.

Takes on teaching classes to forward an ideology rather than to teach or even engage in conversation. Regardless of whether or not you agree with her you are not permitted to think on your own. Class requirement is to write in the perspective of her paradigm without exception. Programs thinking and then scolds when a lapse occurs.  Danger zone!

So I should have been forewarned by previous comments, but I took her anyways. How I regret it. I've never had a harder prof. Getting a C+ is great grade (I get low A's). She's a TOUGH marker & expects TONS of reading each week. BE FOREWARNED: this class will take up ALL your time & it's her way or the highway. DO NOT RECOMMEND HER!!

come on people-what are you at university for?  yeh, she's tough, but i learned more in one semester than i ever have before. if you want an easy grade, go somewhere else. if you want to be pushed by someone who cares, take this prof

Insanely hard marker. You will work SO hard and still never get an A. DO NOT take this prof. I withrdew from her class...TONS of little assignments that she gives you horrible marks on, TONS of reading, just brutal. She wants to hear what SHE thinks. Blah! CAUTION

The classt material was extremley interesting, and karens teaching style is.  However, her marking scheme is horrendous.  DO NOT expect any A's in her class.  Toughest marker I have ever had, and still find myself the same student as I was before I took the class. Take her at your own discretion.  My advice would be to AVOID at all costs.
Karen is a very good prof, but she demands a great deal of effort and thought from her students.  If you're willing to try hard, you end up a better student having taken Karen's classes.

do not take any class with this prof!! plain and simple; avoid her! she asks students to 'figure it out on your own' and then marks you down b/c you didn't get it, even though you probably went to her office hours multiple times asking for help. asks you to write in a prescribed style, without accepting your personal writing differences. AWFUL!!

I actually liked her. Very hard marker, but really made me critically think and that has helped me a lot in my other classes.  Expects a lot during tutorial and her lectures are very interesting.  It is nice to listen to someone so passionate about the subject.
US in Depression & War. Sounds good right? Not with Karen. Unless you like 1 dimensional lefty BS. Nothing but labour movements and civil rights. UGh.

Moody. You can guess what her nickname is in the history department. Seems to think she is funny, but the way she marks is no laughing matter. Requested explanation of a bare pass on a paper and inexplicably had it raised to where it should have been in the first place. Unless you like being annoyed by a spoiled little frat girl, avoid.
No, Dr. Ferguson will not boost your GPA.  She will, however, strengthen your critical thinking and analytical skills, while taking you to the marrow of the history.

Course material is sometimes interesting and sometimes unrelated.  Marking is unfair plain and simple. Seems to assign grades by throwing essays down the stairs. Essay comments made absolutely no sense. I wrote up a series of questions for her and received a higher grade but no explanation!
Very cute. Wish I had taken her class...
One of the few professors at sfu who actually make u think. I didn't think there was that much work required, I liked how passionate she was about the issues, and I still managed to get an A.
hard marker, very moody and unhelpful. Not very helpful when you visit her office hours. avoid at all costs
Would love to find out how she determines grades for marking. Comments made no sense at all.
Unfair instructor. Very unclear as to her expectations and papers are a nighmare. If you are an "A" student you will be lucky if you pull a "B". I know, I am one.
Difficult teacher, but interesting material
Assigned some very interesting reading, but she wasn't easy (but not unfair either) as a grader.  Hottie.
Unrealistic and unfair marker. Received a "B" for a paper and she wouldn't budge. Complained to the department head and it was raised to an "A" Glad I am graduating.

wow, very hard marker! but, this class was the most interesting class i have ever taken at sfu.  very informative and challenging. just needs to let up on the marking a bit.. pushes students to their full potential

one crazy lady! has VERY HIGH expectations for paper. she rips ur paper to shred unless u share her view. Great lectures and great readings. Tutorials are alot of fun but assignments are tough. Take her class and i guarantee u she will scream at u once. Expect GPA to go down!
What is this?  Who comes up with a term paper assignment in which only one interpretation is accurate!  Good intentions but kinda crazy.  Great snorts when laughs
The class content is phenomenal.  I really learned alot and was very impressed by the material.  However, if you are not an english major and you can't read minds...good luck with her!

argh! she changes the criteria for the assignments every time she talks about them so her expectations are extremely unclear. the material is interesting, but her marking is so unfair that she ruins the class.
No Comments

Great perspective and content.  Makes you think about history in a new light, which is needed in this stuffy department.  She can go a little nuts and scare the crap out of students, and there are more readings in one of her courses than all other history classes combined, but its worth it.

This woman is unreal!The lectures are intereting but she is an incredibly hard marker...she'll pick your work apart word by word and is of absolutely no help.She answers your questions with more questions that lead you no where! she needs to learn how to motivate students and give guidance!Rude too!

the material presented in class is interesting, but way beyond the 4th year level.  if she was going to make the class this difficult to grasp, it should be worth more credits... only fair.  she is very opinionated and thinks that all students have no idea of what they are talking about... rude!!!!!
The material is really fascinating, and she's good at lecturing, but, the assignments are really outthere. if you like structured classes. this is not for you.

To say she is a hard marker is an understatement. It would help if she told you what she wanted before she chops your paper to pieces. Also thinks her opinion is somehowm more valuable cause she's the prof. I think she needs a girlfriend.
No Comments

Very opinionated and often angry instructor. Seems to think that just because you are a student you don't know anything and have never done anything either. Very hard and often unfair marker. Likes sycophants.

She has strong opinions.  She can get frustrated easily if the class does not live up to her expectations re. assignments.  But overall a very interesting and informative class on Afr. Am. History.  Her lectures are lively, good readings.

Very smart, but teaches Afro-American history through a straw, very limited perspective (leftist). However, did learn alot, came away from the class affected, but she has little patience for her students.
No Comments
hard marker. good teacher. cute too
No Comments
HARD MARKER!!!!!!!!!
shes alright...hard marker
No Comments
brilliant. encouraging. awesome readings.
We're not in kindergarten anymore!!
Nice person, but hard marker!
